original: Engvall, Eric Hjalmar, kyrkoherde, Svenljunga, f. 29/5/95 i Grönahög, Älvsb. 1. G. 22 m. Edit Lindh. Barn: Kerstin f. 24, Per-Eric 27, Ragnar 29, Lars 31. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 16, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 17, teol. kand. 21, prakt, teol. prov å. V. past. i Norra Få-geläs 21, pastorsadj. i Tidaholm 21, kommini. i Ås le 22, i Tidah olm 30, kyrkoh. i Svenljunga fr. 34. Insp. f. komm. mell :’sk., ordf. i Svenljunga-Ullasjö kyrkofullm., i Örsås kyrkofulil-m., i Svenljunga, Ullasjö, Örsås, Revesjö ikyrkost., i Svenljunga o. Ullasjö skolstyr., i Revesjö o. Redslareds skoil-råd, i Svenljunga-Ullasjö hemhjälps-nd, i Svenljunga, Ullasjö, Örsås, Revesjö o. Redslareds kyrkoråd, insp. f. Svenljungaort. föreläsn :fören., pred. O’, kurator v. Svenljunga sjukstuga, v. ordf. o. led. av pastoratets ,sam ti. bar-nav:ndr. Skr.: upps. i tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Engvall, Eric Hjalmar, vicar, Svenljunga, b. May 29, 1895 in Grönahög, Älvsborg. 1st marriage in 1922 to Edit Lindh. Children: Kerstin b. 1924, Per-Eric b. 1927, Ragnar b. 1929, Lars b. 1931. Education: graduate exam (high school) in Uppsala in 1916, theology degree in Lund in 1921, theological candidate in 1921, practical theology test in a. W. Past. in Norra Fågeläs in 1921, pastor's assistant in Tidaholm in 1921, curate in Åsle in 1922, in Tidaholm in 1930, vicar in Svenljunga from 1934. Inspector of the district's intermediate school, chairman of the Svenljunga-Ullasjö church council and the Örsås church council, in charge of Svenljunga, Ullasjö, Örsås, Revesjö church communities, in charge of Svenljunga and Ullasjö school board, in charge of Revesjö and Redslareds school council, inspector for the Svenljunga local lecture association, preacher, curator of the Svenljunga hospital, deputy chairman and member of the parish's children's welfare committee. Writings: published in newspapers and magazines.

structured.name: Eric Hjalmar Engvall

memberOf.name: Svenljunga, Ullasjö, Örsås, Revesjö Church Communities

structured.description: Eric Hjalmar Engvall was a Swedish vicar born on May 29, 1895 in Grönahög, Älvsborg. He graduated from Uppsala University in 1916 and from Lund University with a theology degree in 1921. He worked as a pastor's assistant and curate before becoming a vicar in Svenljunga in 1934. He was also involved in various church and school organizations and published in newspapers and magazines.
